text:
James Walton
Personal Statement
I am an enthusiastic graduate with a MEng in Chemical Engineering, keen to work in the process industries and apply my university technical knowledge in a practical environment, to broaden my skills and experience. In addition to knowledge of chemical engineering theory, my degree has also allowed me to develop my teamworking skills, through working on many group projects.
During my studies I have been able to gain significant industrial experience through summer placements at CF Fertilisers UK. These placements have given me experience of working on a large, upper tier COMAH, chemical manufacturing site, on several different production plants.

Personal Statement
I am an enthusiastic graduate with a MEng in Chemical Engineering, keen to work in the process industries and apply my university technical knowledge in a practical environment, to broaden my skills and experience. In addition to knowledge of chemical engineering theory, my degree has also allowed me to develop my teamworking skills, through working on many group projects.
During my studies I have been able to gain significant industrial experience through summer placements at CF Fertilisers UK. These placements have given me experience of working on a large, upper tier COMAH, chemical manufacturing site, on several different production plants.
Through my industrial experience I developed my practical technical skills as I carried out plant investigations and design work. I was able to enhance my teamworking and interpersonal skills, working alongside engineers from different disciplines, plant operators and delivering presentations to senior management.
Throughout my Masters year I gained research experience, working with Autichem, a specialist in the development of continuous flow reactors, to develop and improve the effectiveness of an advanced reactor.
Qualifications
Masters Degree : University of Chester (2015-2019)
MEng (Hons) Chemical Engineering 2nd Class where I averaged a 2:1 in the MEng year.
My Masters modules included: A Research Project, Project Management, Process Modelling & Simulation, Nuclear Technology, Pharmaceuticals and Food Technology.
A Levels: Tarporley Sixth Form College
Mathematics (B), Chemistry (B), Physics (D)
AS Level: Biology (C)
GCSE: Tarporley Community High School
Chemistry (A*), Biology (A*), Physics (A), Maths (A), English Literature (B), English Language (B), Geography (B), History (B), Business Studies (B), ICT (Merit), French (B)
Industrial Experience
2018-2019 Autichem, Thornton Research Park, Chester
I conducted a research project utilising microalgae to absorb CO2 in a prototype reactor, which included
Performing a range of experiments on the reactor.
Interpreting the experimental data to identify the ideal conditions, such as residence time and flowrates, to maximise the performance of the microalgae within the reactor.
Making recommendations for improvements which will be implemented into the design of the reactor.
Summer 2017 : CF Fertilisers UK, Ince, Chester
I developed the process design for a new steam desuperheater station, which involved:
Producing a process specification following review of plant data
Working with an equipment supplier to select the optimum equipment design.
Designing control system, selection of installation location, developing P&ID, participation in HAZOP study, production of project scope and initiation of Management of Change document.
The design I proposed was successfully installed in a plant outage in 2018.
Summer 2016 : CF Fertilisers UK, Ince, Chester
I lead an investigation into intermittent periods of excessively high temperature in the low-pressure steam supply to the ammonium nitrate (AN) plant, which risked initiating decomposition of the product. This involved:
Identifying all supplies into the site low pressure steam supply
Correlating the periods of high temperatures in the steam supply to the AN plant with the operation of different plants across the site.
Identifying potential sources of high temperature steam and using plant measurements and heat and mass balances to confirm those which were responsible for the high temperatures seen in the LP steam supply.
I then investigated alternative options to prevent the excessive temperatures.
I also carried out post installation checks on plant changes and marked up P&IDs
Summer 2015 : GrowHow UK (now CF Fertilisers UK), Ince, Chester
I carried out performance trials on a large gas fired 35 bar steam generator to assess the efficiency and capacity compared with original design.
The trials identified that the boiler maximum output was reduced from design, due to faults in the control of the burners which were restricting the firing.
Following correction of the identified faults, the maximum steam output was increased by over 150 tonnes/day, resulting in signif

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
